summary: Potential Log4Shell exploitation targeting internal search and API services, evidenced by suspicious HTTP requests to /api/search followed by PowerShell execution and lateral movement via Kerberos authentication.

evidence.reason: Correlates with the vulnerable 'search-service' identified in the patch plan; DELETE requests to search endpoints are a common Log4Shell exploitation vector.
Indicates potential reconnaissance or data staging using a command-line interface frequently used post-exploitation.
Automated tool usage targeting a login endpoint suggests brute-forcing or session hijacking attempts following initial access.
Execution of PowerShell suggests the attacker has achieved code execution (RCE) and is attempting to maintain access or move laterally.

attack_mapping.rationale: The timeline shows a DELETE request to /api/search matching the vulnerable search-service component (Log4j), indicating an exploit attempt.

attack_mapping.technique: T1059.001 - Command and Scripting Interpreter: PowerShell
attack_mapping.rationale: Multiple EDR events detect PowerShell file reads and process starts, indicative of execution commands.
A high volume of successful Kerberos authentications for multiple users (svc-ci, admin, alice) suggests credential theft or use of valid accounts for lateral movement.

containment_steps.action: Isolate hosts web-srv-01 and app-srv-02 from the network
containment_steps.why: These hosts are identified as running vulnerable Log4j versions and are likely the entry point or target of the attack.

containment_steps.action: Block external IP 203.0.113.50 at the perimeter firewall
containment_steps.why: This IP appears in the source list and may be the command and control (C2) server or attack origin.

containment_steps.action: Disable the svc-ci and admin service accounts temporarily
containment_steps.why: These accounts show suspicious activity patterns and may be compromised.

remediation_steps.action: Apply Log4j patches to search-service, api-gateway, payment-processor, and logging-aggregator
remediation_steps.why: To remediate the CVE-2021-44228 and CVE-2021-45046 vulnerabilities allowing remote code execution.

remediation_steps.action: Force reset passwords for all users showing auth activity in the timeline (admin, alice, charlie, svc-ci)
remediation_steps.why: To invalidate any stolen credentials used for lateral movement.

remediation_steps.action: Review and restrict PowerShell usage policies on jumpbox-01 and web-srv-01
remediation_steps.why: PowerShell was used for suspicious activity; constraining it reduces the attack surface.
